about.title: About us
about.text1: The journal Research in Adult Learning and Education (RALED) is a publication for Uzbek and global practitioners and researchers involved in lifelong learning, ensuring the quality of education and training for adults taking into account the requirements of the labor market.
about.text2: We are committed to promoting lifelong learning and empowering people to thrive in an ever-changing society. We recognize the value of adult education as a transformative force that not only equips people with essential research-based and competency-based skills, but also promotes personal growth, social inclusion and economic development.
about.text3: The magazine covers formal and non-formal education aimed at promoting adult participation in society and work. Each issue of our magazine is devoted to a wide range of topics, including, but not limited to the following areas:
about.list2: Development of social partnership with the stakeholders in constructive way;
about.list3: Advanced training and retraining of the personnel and management;
about.raleb: RALED strives to provide an environment for informed discussion of the principles and practices that guide the way all aspects of adult education and learning are taught and implemented throughout the world. It also provides a forum for the exchange of information and ideas among practitioners and researchers around the world.
about.text4: Our team of distinguished researchers, educators, and practitioners are passionate about shedding light on the multifaceted aspects of adult learning. Through rigorous research, evidence-based research and thought-provoking analysis, we aim to contribute to scholarly discourse and inform policy and practice in adult education, and to present diverse perspectives and interdisciplinary research that reflect the global nature of adult education and the unique challenges faced by students in different societies and cultures.
about.text5: Thank you to those who have joined us in this quest for knowledge and transformation. Let's explore the exciting field of adult learning and education together and work towards creating a more inclusive, equitable and enlightened society.
about.text6: Submit your reserach paper XXXX or contact us via + 998 97 776-76-61

redikt.about1: Doctor of Pedagogical Sciences, Professor of Tashkent State Pedagogical University named after Nizami (Tashkent)
redikt.about2: Doctor of Science in Pedagogy. Professor of the University of World Languages. National Expert on Quality Assurance in Education. ETF Expert. National Expert of “Management & Management” organization
redikt.about3: Indiana University Bloomington, USA 20+ years’ experience in higher education. Master's degree in Instructional Systems Technology
redikt.about4: Webster University in Tashkent EFL/ESL/EAP instructor/Curriculum Developer/ Test designer/ Material designer
redikt.about5: Researcher. ETF expert. Specialist with international experience in the fields of NQF, ISCED (UNESCO), Quality Assurance in Education. Director of the “Mahorat & Management” organization
redikt.about6: Has worked in English language education as a teacher and manager for 40+ years. Executive Council of TESOL Arabia from 1997 to 2014
redikt.about7: Chair, Department of Teacher Education, Visiting Professor Educational Technology at Webster University in Tashkent
redikt.about8: PhD student at the university of Aberdeen, UK. Coordinator of Master's Programs in Education and Innovation, Webster University in Tashkent. Assistant Professor of Design Thinking
redikt.about9: PhD, Senior Lecturer at Yeoju Technical Institute in Tashkent

send.title: Submission of materials:
send.text1: Authors should ensure that their submissions comply with the following requirements. Non-compliant submissions may be returned.
send.reqlist1: Must be in Microsoft Word format.
send.reqlist2: Typed in Times New Roman font, 14-point size, with 1.5 line spacing.
send.reqlist3: Margins should be 2 centimeters on all sides.
send.sourcestext: Sources should be listed in the following order: [1], [2], [3]: author's surname, book title, publisher's address, year, pages.
send.addreqtext: If the article is in Russian or Uzbek, the above information must be provided in a separate file in English. Title: The English title of the article. Author information: surname, first name, full name of the organization and postal address, email address. Abstract: In Russian and English, 150-250 words. Keywords: In English, 6-10 words or phrases. Introduction: Research objective and hypothesis. Main body: Methods, results, and discussion. Conclusion: A brief summary of the research results, should not exceed 10% of the total text. References: In Harvard style, at least 15 sources, sources should be cited in the text in square brackets (e.g., [2], [4; 5]).
send.edittext: In MS Word format, Times New Roman, 12-point size, with one and a half spacing. Margins: left - 2.5 cm, top, bottom, and right - 1.5 cm each. Languages: English, Uzbek, and/or Russian. Tables and charts: in MS Word or MS Excel format. Email:
